title: Why You Should Buy PayPoint And Its 8.5% Dividend Yield Following This News
text: PayPoint's put out another top trading statement in midweek trading. But it's not the only great income share you need to buy right now.

title: Futures hit as DOJ aims antitrust probe at tech
text: U.S. stock index futures dropped on Wednesday, pressured by a fall in big tech companies after the announcement of a broad antitrust investigation by the U.S. Justice Department into the sector.

title: Is Geopolitical Tension Really Helping Oil Prices?
text: The devil is in the details and by looking at the forward contract market, it becomes clear why the current move in the oil price is lifeless

title: Global oil market in glut, but not a big enough one for OPEC
text: OPEC has shifted the goalposts for assessing an overhang in oil inventories, giving the group more room to prolong production cuts, while analysts warn the move will offer a distorted view of market conditions.

title: Mortgage demand falls again, despite lower interest rates
text: After rising the previous week, interest rates fell back again last week, but consumers were not enthused.

title: Oil edges up on U.S. stock decline, Mideast tensions
text: Oil prices nudged higher on Wednesday, supported by a sharp fall in U.S. crude stocks and tensions over Iran.

title: Oil Rises As Industry Report Shows Hefty Drop In U.S. Stockpiles
text: Oil rose for a 4th day after a report showed a hefty drop in U.S. crude inventories and as the resumption of face-to-face trade discussions.

title: Trade talks keep stocks afloat, weak PMIs sink euro
text: Global shares crept higher on Wednesday as prospects of fresh China-U.S. trade talks drew a guarded welcome from investors, while dour data on euro zone economic activity hit the euro ahead of a European Central Bank policy meeting.

title: Stocks Struggle As Nasdaq Futures Drop; Oil Gains: Markets Wrap
text:
Stocks in Europe struggled for traction and American futures slipped as investors weigh the latest raft of corporate news against resumption of trade talks.
The post Stocks Struggle As Nasdaq Futures Drop; Oil Gains: Markets Wrap appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: China's tax cuts may be able to offset the cost of trade tariffs, economist says
text: Tax cuts could support economic growth, even if the trade war doesn't ease, according to a Chinese investment banking firm.

title: Exclusive: Bearing brunt of trade war, Singapore chipmakers cut jobs
text: Caught between a Sino-U.S. trade war, political concerns over Chinese telecoms firm Huawei and slowing consumer demand,  chipmakers in Singapore have started slowing production and laying off hundreds of jobs, firms told Reuters.

title: Capitalism gone wrong: how big pharma created America's opioid carnage
text: A web of firms ramped up narcotic painkiller sales, creating the biggest drug epidemic in American history as profits surged

title: European markets seen slightly higher amid expectations ECB could cut rates before Fed
text: Market focus is largely attuned to global central banks, amid expectations the ECB and the Federal Reserve could soon cut interest rates.

title: Philippines' Jollibee buying U.S. firm Coffee Bean for $100 million
text: Philippines' Jollibee Foods Corp  said on Wednesday it is buying U.S. brand Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf for $100 million.
